creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
text: Savoir faire—knowing what to do. This man may not be a nobleman, but he knows how to act and how to dress when attending a ball. A touch of the Turk in the hat, some quotations from classical architecture in the trim, and plenty of silk, bows, fur and fringe. Bend the pinky just so, and you’re off.
title: Gentleman Dressed for a Ball
